intro: Endiandra albiramea, commonly known as the white-flowered endiandra, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the rainforests of Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, white flowers that bloom in clusters, often attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are typically elliptical and arranged alternately along the stem. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
